revised_title: The United States Space Research Program and its Objectives
tldr: The article discusses the United States' space research program, established by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) in 1958. The program aimed to improve aeronautical and space vehicles, conduct studies on Earth's atmosphere, ionosphere, high-energy particles, fields, photons, and astronomy, and perform controlled experiments in extreme conditions. The article also highlights the collaboration with international organizations like COSPAR to contribute to the benefit of all mankind.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Space Science
